  "section_exercises": [
    {
      "section_title": "Descriptive Statistics",
      "text": "For the `chicago_air` dataset, calculate the mean, median, standard deviation, and variance of the ozone levels.",
      "solution": "mean(chicago_air$ozone, na.rm = TRUE)\n\nmedian(chicago_air$ozone, na.rm = TRUE)\n\nsd(chicago_air$ozone, na.rm = TRUE)\n\nvar(chicago_air$ozone, na.rm = TRUE)",
      "output": "mean: 31.44583\n\nmedian: 23\n\nstandard deviation: 20.52398\n\nvariance: 421.0113",
      "hints": [],
      "explanation": ""
    },
    {
      "section_title": "Correlation",
      "text": "Calculate the correlation between the temperature and ozone levels in the `chicago_air` dataset, ignoring `NA` values.",
      "solution": "cor(chicago_air$temp, chicago_air$ozone, use = \"pairwise.complete.obs\")",
      "output": "correlation: 0.6067166",
      "hints": [],
      "explanation": ""
    },
    {
      "section_title": "T-Tests",
      "text": "Perform a one-sample t-test to determine if the mean ozone concentration in the `chicago_air` dataset is different from 0.035 ppm.",
      "solution": "t.test(chicago_air$ozone, mu = 0.035, na.rm = TRUE)",
      "output": "p-value: 0.0001321",
      "hints": [],
      "explanation": ""
    },
    {
      "section_title": "One-Way ANOVA",
      "text": "Using the `chicago_air` dataset, perform a one-way ANOVA to test if there is a difference in mean ozone concentration between months.",
      "solution": "anova_model <- aov(ozone ~ month, data = chicago_air)\nsummary(anova_model)",
      "output": "F-statistic: 2.554, p-value: 0.06426",
      "hints": [],
      "explanation": ""
    },
    {
      "section_title": "Simple Linear Regression",
      "text": "Fit a simple linear regression model to predict ozone level from temperature in the `chicago_air` dataset. Display the model's summary.",
      "solution": "lm_model <- lm(ozone ~ temp, data = chicago_air)\nsummary(lm_model)",
      "output": "R-squared: 0.3677",
      "hints": [],
      "explanation": ""
    }
  ]
